WRITING.TEXT: Really -_-. They upgrade people who don't get the premium room and they downgrade people who do. 3 times we have gotten a premium view only to be put in an okay view. This makes me angry.
I got fastpasses at around 8 am and the they were due 5:20-6:30. It wasn't even that crowded that day

I really enjoy it. However, I think if you really want to go on it, you should just get a fastpass early in the day. it makes the lines about 10 times shorter and you still get to go on it. I'm not the type of person who is going to wait that long for anything but if you absolutely have to go on it and fastpasses aren't avaliable, you should just wait it out.
I think you print out a form and you get your ticket at the entrance of disneyland or dca.

There was a rumor that DL is getting magic bands. A cast member saw at a vending cart. Original Post: http://discuss.micechat.com/forum/disney-theme-park-news-and-discussion/disneyland-resort/8423128-magic-band-reader-spotted-in-dca

Okay fine. I seriously don't know how I do it. I think of something and it appears on the computer. I honestly don't know how it works. I just tried it one day and this is what it did. I guess anything is possible if you're a rock with consciousness.

Well, being a rock, I don't really do anything. I just sort of sit around. Sometimes I get kicked around. Once I got all the way to the river. I went down quite a ways and then got stuck by a log. Someone tried to skip me across the water but ended up throwing me to the other side. That was pretty fun...
That's a complicated one. It'll be in my memoirs some day.

Well normally I just sit around doing nothing although sometimes I do get picked up or thrown around. Someone painted a face on me yesterday and now I'm in their living room. That's probably the most interesting thing that's happened to me. Oh and yes I do get bored often.
Do you still have technology on board or did you pretty muhch just go back in time?
Is scrabble your actual favorite game? I know people who are good at soccer but they prefer basketball. If it isn't your favorite, what is?

Minions movie. You have to create as many products and crappy memes until you get enough money to produce a sequel. You continue until you have 10 sequels and you rule a world of minion-loving zombies.
Cake. Way too sugary for me. Instant Headache.
"release the wolverines"
Do you have standards on people who get thrown in Hell? I mean, are there certain people you don't even want *there*

WRITING.TITLE: How do I get started?
WRITING.TEXT: I started animation about two months ago and I'm getting fairly frustrated. I've watched hundreds of tutorials on animating and character design. And yet, I still can't make anything better than a bouncing ball. I don't know if it's my drawing skills or I just don't practice enough. I just want to know what I'm doing wrong and why I just can't seem to get any better. (fyi, I use adobe flash)
Eh me neither. I like them because they take about 40% of the crowds. However, if you want to go across main street during parades you're screwed.

The reason a lot of people hate WOC is because it has no story or deeper meaning. It's just projections of Disney Movies on water. It still is beautiful but not what people would expect of Disney. I honestly think that Fantasmic is better. However, if I'm in Paradise Pier at the moment the show is going on, I'll stop and watch for a few minutes. I don't hate WOC but It's not my favorite show at Disneyland. I hope you understand why certain people don't like it. Oh and not to mention they close Screamin for it. No more riding it at night :(
Just read Disneyland's FAQ on the dress code. :P Sorry, You can't wear costumes unless it's at a designated event.

1. I would count on the parks being pretty crowded. 2. I don't think you should buy a ticket for that day. It won't give you a lot of park time plus those tickets are very expensive. It'll give you more time to settle it. 3.That kind of depends. Since you have infants I don't reccomend going to any super fancy places so you won't have to reserve much. 4. Anything at Disneyland can be memorable. Just have a good time and it will be perfect.
Instead of writing a 5 paragraph essay for an argument, I will just say four things. -Buzz Is Fun -Buss Relates To Disney -Buzz is futuristic -Buzz fits End of story.
Me neither. Everybody gives me all kinds of advise on hitting certain targets when I have no idea where I'm even shooting.
Tough One. Buzz Is Fun but Haunted mansion is a classic. Eh, I'd have to go with Haunted Mansion. It's a long relaxing ride with some cool effects.

a candy bar. :( I don't have very much karma
From my experiences I have to completely disagree with this. Lufthansa is my favorite airline. Enough Said

WRITING.TITLE: What's This Pin Worth?
WRITING.TEXT: A few weeks ago, my friend brought me back a limited edition silver diamond pin. It flips to a picture of Walt Disney. I went to the d23 expo and they didn't have it at any of the booths. I'm curious how much it's worth. They had similar different colored ones that were about 70$.
That's when we're going too! Crowds should be fine.
Sleeping Beauty's Castle. If you're looking for a thrill you can go on the Fun Wheel, but the castle, in my opinion, is better. I really hate mickey's fun wheel though :P.
That's actually a very good day to go. Christmas decorations are up and not many people go right after thanksgiving. It should be very nice.

If you're tired of crowds you can go into this secret area next to the harbor galley. It's this little alleyway to the left of the building. It looks like a behind the scenes area but it's not. You can get a great view of riders coming down splash mountain and a quiet and peaceful area all to yourself.
1. I reccomend doing fasspass. At the longest you'll wait about 20 minutes. 2. I would just check up on the lines every once in a while. The lines can vary.
That would be cool.
I like Mr. Toad's I feel that Fantasyland could use another dark ride though.

WRITING.TEXT: I want to hear an opninion. What do you think should be replaced in the parks and what should go there? In my opinion, Autopia should be replaced with another ride thats a bit more future oriented.
Space mountain is a lot smoother and it has music here in California. I think that's the biggest comparison I can make. A lot is the same a lot is different.
It's been gone for a while.
A fusion of Peridot and Steven
Yes! I am! This subreddit finally gives me something that I haven't experienced in years: The joy of rain.
Good Idea. I have adobe flash. I might be able to make something

I just found this page and I realized how much I love the rain. I live in California and we haven't had rain in months. Despite rain being thought of as being a sad sort of weather. I think sunny, no-cloud-in-the-sky days are taking that spot.
I live in the same area. I really hope it starts raining soon. Darn California!

WRITING.TITLE: Disneyland Ghosts?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

Here are some disneyland secrets/trivia/tips 1. The fire station on main street used to be Walt's apartment 2. The skull above the skeleton on the bed in Pirates is a real human skull 3. The track you see when you're on Mark Twain or Columbia was from a ride called "Rainbow Caverns Mine train" 4. The truck and the minecart in the outdoor line for Indiana Jones are real props from the Raiders of the Lost Arc and The Temple of Doom. 5. There is a basketball half-court at the top of the Matterhorn 6. Despite whatever cast members say, the small circle on the floor next to the castle is not the center of the park. 7. When you're in the boiler room in the tower of terror listen closely to the sounds made by the machinery. You may hear some creepy things.(I won't spoil it.) 8. In the library of Tower of Terror there are several props from the twilight zone show. (ex. a devil napkin holder thing on top of the back shelf) 9. If you see someone with sunglasses with a cast member, chances are they're famous.
I would rent out Hollywoodland because, first of all I love Tower of Terror, and second of all, the animation building. Also I could get some hot dogs at award wiener.

WRITING.TITLE: Estimates on Star Wars Land opening?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been hearing rumors about how Star Wars Land was going to take 7 years to finish. I was extremely worried that it would take that long so I decided to check in with the general public. If anyone has any official dates or rough estimates I would love to hear them. Thanks!

Expect it to be very crowded. I don't want to be a killjoy but Halloween time is the most crowded time of the year. Word of advice: If you want to take pictures and do good rides arrive early. If you have magic morning, then use it because that may be the only time you don't have massive crouds.

No matter how crouded it is, you can still find ways to have a good time. The best thing to do it plan it all out. You need to pinpoint what rides will be crouded and when they will. Since you're going in November, chances are Haunted Mansion holiday will be packed. If you absolutely want to go on it, either wait in a long line or try to go early in the morning (opening to 10:00 AM). I suggest making reservations if you are going to eat at Carthay Circle or Blue Bayou. The park will be the most crowded after lunch, so I reccomend doing some smaller rides at that time (ex. Fantasyland rides, BUT not peter pan). If you want to get on good rides be sure to go early because most annual-pass holders don't get to the park very early. Good luck and have fun!
